@gaurabdg @rnveach
My suggestion was - we can set nodeDepth during constructing xpath tree
nodeDepth will field be of the AbstractNode class
RootNode.nodeDepth will be zero
and at this line we will have:
nodeDepth = parent.nodeDepth + 1;
and that's all, share your ideas

@timurt @rnveach I didn't know whether to touch other modules or not. It can be done and will be more efficient. So, shall I create a depth attribute of DetailASTImpl class and pass on this.depth + 1 while creating child nodes? Let me know what should be done, meanwhile I'll add the tests

@gaurabdg
We have two trees:

one is AST tree with DetailAST objects, used by almost all checks to validate rules
another one is Xpath tree with classes implementing NodeInfo(saxon) interface, this tree is used only for querying nodes using xpath queries

Xpath tree nodes have reference to corresponding AST tree nodes
Construction of the xpath tree starts with RootNode, as argument RootNode constructor takes root DetailAst object, and recursively traverse AST tree and creates corresponding Xpath nodes
For example for SuppressionXpathFilter, we create RootNode here,
Violation event TreeWalkerAuditEvent itself contains reference to rootAst, so we can create Xpath tree from it
is it clear? I know it is not obvious, so please ask questions

As far as I understand this depth approach, it should be fully correlate with line/column ordering.
It means for all nodes in getXpathItems(xpath, rootNode); the following condition is true:
node[i].lineNumber < node[j].lineNumber or (node[i].lineNumber = node[j].lineNumber and node[i].columnNumber < node[j].columnNumber) where i < j.
It is easier to write because all NodeInfo subclasses implement getLineNumber(), getColumnNumber() using real DetailAst values.
There is more difficult way to write this test:

get results from getXpathItems(xpath, rootNode);
convert them to DetailAST[] using convertToArray(List<NodeInfo> nodes) method
get rootAst from RootNode
traverse rootAst with DFS and check that all elements DetailAST[] appear in exact same order
